form_title.ms_form_title_llm_v1: Petition to Change Status of Relative for Issuance of Immigrant Visa and Naturalization Service Form I-130, I--130

full_text: Form approved. Budget Bureau No. 43-R401.4. ATION TO SIFY STATUS OF NOV RECEIVED Destaulated 16 966 10.00 FEE PAID No. 94-3 IEN RELATIVE FOR AND NATURALIZATION SERVA SLB NEF CLEVELAND, ONIO J.C. ISSUANCE OF IMMI- IMMIG. & NATZ, T. C. SECTION DATE 11/14/66 VERIFIED BY MAA GRANT VISA Cleveland, Ohio / (Read this form and the attached instructions carefully before filling in petition) TO THE SECRETARY OF STATE: The petition is revalidated: The petition was filed on The petition is approved for status under section 201 (b) Remarks: Praission (District Director) wiz (District Director) Cleveland, Ohio (District) (District) NOV 29 1966 (Date) (Date) (PETITIONER IS NOT TO WRITE ABOVE THIS LINE) 1. Petition is hereby made to classify the status of the alien beneficiary for issuance of an immigrant visa as: (Check one) The spouse, child (regardless of age), parent, brother, or sister of a United States citizen. The spouse or unmarried child (regardless of age) of an alien lawfully admitted to the United States for permanent residence. Block I.-Information About Petitioner 2. Name Martha Widlus (First name) (Middle name, (Last name) formerly mrs. Klein (Jayson) If you are a married woman, give your maiden name 339 Ormsby Road Akron Ohio 44313 3. I reside in United States at (Number and street) (Town or city) (State) (ZIP Code) (Apt. No.) Address abroad (if any) (Number and street) (City or town) (Province) (Country) June 4, 1933 Montreal Quebec Canada 4. I was born (City or town) (State or Province) (Country) 1/2 sunand returned (Date) (us) 5. If you are a citizen of the United States, give the following: a. Was your citizenship acquired through birth in the United States, through naturalization, through parentage, or through marriage? naturalization C/N asenand returned (mg) (1) If acquired through naturalization, give number of naturalization certificate and date and place of naturalization: No. 7933408 May 6, 1957 Southern District of New York (2) If acquired through parentage or marriage, have you obtained new a certificate of citizenship in your own name based on such you acquisition? (a) If so, give number of certificate: (b) If not, submit evidence of citizenship in accordance with Instruction 3a(2) no b. Have you or any person through whom you claim citizenship ever lost United States citizenship If so, attach detailed explanation on separate sheet. 6. If you are a lawful permanent resident alien of the United States, give the following: a. Alien Registration Number: A- b. Date, place, and means of admission for lawful permanent residence C. Have you ever lost status as a lawful permanent resident alien? If so, explain: Form I-130 UNITED STATES DEPARTMENT OF Immigration and NaturalizationD Service G-22.2b, G23.2) (Rev. 2-15-66) Received Tr. In Retd-Tr. Out Completed NOV 28 1966 NOV 2 I 1966
